com.yantra.api.ycp.participant

Interface manageCustomer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface manageCustomer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageCustomer(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The manageCustomer is used to create, modify, or delete a customer of an organization.

    • Method Detail

      • manageCustomer

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageCustomer(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException
        The manageCustomer is used to create, modify, or delete a customer of an organization.

        There are two types of customer.

        1. Business : CustomerType = 01. This type of customer represents an existing buyer organization, an existing node, a new node, or a new buyer organization.

        If a new buyer organization, or node is passed, it will be created prior to defining it as a new customer.
        Only one customer can be created for a given OrganizationCode and Buyer Organization.A property has been provided to disable this validation (to maintain backward compatibility). If there are multiple business customers, it would affect access policies configured based Customer hierarchies and might affect the BillToID attribute (when defaulted) for such customers' Orders.

        2. Consumer : CustomerType = 02. This type of customer represents a consumer.

        The default Operation for the API is Manage, which will act as Create if the specified customer does not exist and act as Modify if it does. Additionally, Delete can be passed to remove an existing customer.

        Defaulting Logic:

        Some of the User's information will be defaulted from its Customer and Customer Contact if it is not already provided. All of this logic only applies if the User element is passed into the manageCustomer API:

        • OrganizationKey attribute:
          • If the User's OrganizationKey is missing, then it will be defaulted from the Customer's BuyerOrganizationCode.
          • If BuyerOrganizationCode is missing then the Customer's OrganizationCode will be used instead.
        • ContactPersonInfo element:
          • If the User's ContactPersonInfo element is missing, then it will first look for its Contact's CustomerAdditionalAddressList. The default ship-to PersonInfo record from the CustomerAdditionalAddressList will be used to populate the User's ContactPersonInfo element.
          • Additional logic will be used if a default ship-to record cannot be found, or if there are still empty attributes in the ContactPersonInfo element. Any common attribute between the ContactPersonInfo element and its CustomerContact element will be matched up and used to fill in the missing ContactPersonInfo attributes.
        • Username attribute:
          • The User's Username will be created from the ContactPersonInfo's FirstName and LastName. This logic will apply to any user related API, and not just manageCustomer. The FirstName and LastName attributes allow 40 characters each, but Username only allows 50. So, the Username will be created to look like one of two ways:
            • Less than 50 characters = FirstName + " " + LastName (ex: "Joe Smith")
            • Greater than 50 characters = FirstName's first initial + ". " + LastName (ex: "J. Smith")
        • When the installation rule for "Default User From Customer Organization" flag is set, the enterprise code on the user will be defaulted from the customer's master organization.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetCustomerIDUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YCPManageCustomerUE

        All User related User Exits can be found in createUserHierarchy

        Events Raised:
        The AFTER_CREATE_CUSTOMER event for the CUSTOMER_DEFINITION transaction is raised after successful creation of a customer.

        AFTER_CREATE_CUSTOMER

          Data published - YCP_CUSTOMER_DEFINITION.AFTER_CREATE_CUSTOMER.xml
          Key data - Key Data
          Template Support - Yes


        The ON_ACCOUNT_LIMIT_CHANGE event for the CUSTOMER_DEFINITION transaction is raised when account limit for a customer account is changed.

        ON_ACCOUNT_LIMIT_CHANGE
          Data published - YCP_CUSTOMER_DEFINITION.ON_ACCOUNT_LIMIT_CHANGE.xml
          Key data - Key Data
          Template Support - Yes

        The AFTER_MODIFY_CUSTOMER event for the CUSTOMER_DEFINITION transaction is raised after successful modification of a customer.

        AFTER_MODIFY_CUSTOMER
          Data published - YCP_CUSTOMER_DEFINITION.AFTER_MODIFY_CUSTOMER.xml
          Key data - Key Data
          Template Support - Yes

        The AFTER_DELETE_CUSTOMER event for the CUSTOMER_DEFINITION transaction is raised after successful deletion of a customer.

        AFTER_DELETE_CUSTOMER
          Data published - YCP_CUSTOMER_DEFINITION.AFTER_DELETE_CUSTOMER.xml
          Key data - Key Data
          Template Support - Yes

        All User related Events can be found in createUserHierarchy

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated associated output xml files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
